=== Pending issues ===
* Occasionally the Broadcom WLAN adapters does not work.
* Untested 7.04 issues on newer versions (hibernate, euro key, sleep-wakeup)

=== (*) Notes and recipes ===

* There seems to be multiple versions of this notebook. Here, for Ubuntu 7.04 is described a version with the Broadcom WLAN, 2000 mAh Li-ion battery, VGA ATI Radeon Xpress 1100, 60GB hard disk. For Ubuntu 8.10 is described a version with 80GB hard disk.

==== Image seen on screen ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): (with ATI Radeon Xpress 1100) fglrx driver

==== Correct resolution/refresh ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): (with ATI Radeon Xpress 1100) fglrx driver, 1280x800 60Hz

==== External monitor works ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): fglrx driver

==== Suspends ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): WLAN not working after wake up. CPU fan also not working!

==== Sounds on speakers ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): See solution in http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-343179.html
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): Feisty's solution not tested.

==== Wireless NIC ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): Occasionally the Broadcom WLAN adapters does not work. (IRQ not ready error.) This can be fixed by unloading and loading the bcm43xx module
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): The broadcom issues seem to be related with a hardware matter; Microsoft Windows sometimes doesn't detect any wifi network.

==== Local language characters ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): Doesn't type $ nor €.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): All works on french keyboard
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): $ nor € not tested.

==== Live-CD boots until desktop ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): 32 bit and 64 bit works from desktop install CD
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): 64-bits Live-CD doesn't boot; only shows a basic console screen.
